reviewText:
The idea is solid, and it looks alright, but it lacks polish. The controls are sluggish and unresponsive, the physics are pretty janky, and although these is somewhat mitigated by the fact that you can instantly reset a stage whenever you want, restarting can also screw with you because your controls sometimes just don't work for a few moments after you restart, which is frustrating when you get to some later levels that require essentially perfect execution to get a full score, which is hard enough with the game controlling the way it does. Predicting the Plumber's path can be difficult at times, because his timing seems to be somewhat inconsistent in relation to your position, although that might have been me not being accustomed enough to the game. The music gets grating after a while, too.

Also, whatever you do, do not alt-tab the game (at least if you're in fullscreen). I made the mistake of alt-tabbing, which caused the game to completely lock me out, and after I had to shut it down and restart it, I lost all of the progress I made up to that point. This happened twice, because I guess I don't learn from my own mistakes.

I'm not saying the game should be completely avoided, there's some fun to be had with it, and as I said, the core idea is good enough to carry it. But in it's state right now, it plays like a mess and feels unrefined.

reviewText:
Try the game out here if you want and its totally FREE to paly.

http://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/656192

Imagine playing a one of the minions who's trying to stop an aggressive plumber individual from invading your kingdom.
This plumber has incredible speed and agility leaving you with limited abilities depending on what minion/s you're controlling at the given level.

This game seems to give a parody of that one game that we all know and to make us play on the opposite side of the coin and how it's tough to stop such plumber like this one.

So it's about him versus your wit and precise timing to do every trick possible to stop him from advancing & take the flags at the end so off you go!

Pros:

It's colorful
It's incredibly easy to play but a bit tougher to master especially when you're trying to break the record.
Great music
Easy controls and best played with a gamepad
The game is very light and just about the right size and price
It can be a quick time wasting game if you so wish to do so

Cons:

Some small bugs but not game breaking
voteText: 44 of 58 people (76%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Be the hero! or no.. hmm.. be the enemy! ehh that's almost right... Oh yes! be the enemy and the only hero in your kingdom of goons. You know that time when a famous super plumber jumps around the world killing everything he sees? well then let's rotate it. Keep your princess alive and save her before the plumber gets her! kill the plumber well.. not the one with the letter M on his cap.. ugh.. JUST A PLUMBER! Start with a goon that can't even jump, but gets stronger and more powerful level to level. The more levels you beat, the more you unlock. The plumber has unlimited lives, but you have more tries! Stomp him, spike him or freeze him! all of these things are in game and there are even more to check out! Fight through very difficult levels, but thats not a problem, the plumber is the problem! Make Grassland, Desertland and Iceland clearer and saver so the plumber has no more possibility enter these areas again.. if he's not dead. Get all three stars on any map to access the Lost Levels (Map 1) and Minus World (Map 2) also new Lost Levels 2 (Map 3)

Why I recommend it:

When I was a kid I was wondering how it would be if the enemies are the heroes, now we know it!
I played all day to unlock more troops and bosses. Kill The Plumber plays really great
and there are no difficult achievements to get. Also a fun challenge fighting through a speedrun mode that takes you time to beat.

- Challenging and enjoyable levels
- Great working enemies
- Cool ideas
- Nice level design
- Good music
and more great things!

Kill The Plumber is definitely worth to buy. You can also test this game out before buying: www.dojo.com/game/kill-the-plumber (this isn't the new kill the plumber, it's just the old browser version of this game. It doesn't include new worlds and enemies.)

I'm excited for new updates and features

Thanks for reading :)

reviewText:
If you have ever wanted to be on the enemy's side on a platform game, this is it. And it works great.

Save your kingdom from a maniac, princess-stalking plumber who's on a brainless roll. Control several different enemies, often more than one at once. Kill, survive, drop him off the screen, even be a big boss. You get to beat him in many different scenarios, and the faster you do it, the better rating (from 0 to 3 stars).

Truth be told, this is a puzzle game. You need to figure out how to (usually) kill the plumber, which is solving the puzzle. You get lots of puzzles, each with a twist. There's a difficulty curve so you feel the progression. Controls have great response, the plumber always behaves as it should (nothing erratic), and the mechanics are easy to grasp. There are bonus levels in each of the three worlds that are a lot harder, and there is also a time-attack for all the stages in each world. Achievements are included!

The game looks spot-on considering it's classic platformer theme. It's theme is a parody, so characters are easily recognizeable with their similarities. The interface does it's simple job efficiently, It's easy and really quick to go from levels to options to achievement room (it looks obvious when you play it, which is the point: it's well designed). Art style doesn't look too cartoony nor too stiff.

I've been having a great time with it. I barely ever play single player games, but this one reeled me in. Some more bang to your buck than usual. If you like it's idea, killing the plumber in memorable moments, I deffinetly recommend it.

reviewText:
Disclaimer: Don‚Äôt froth at the mouth/get all grumpy because I am writing a review for a 4 dollar game while having less than 200 hours of gameplay. You get the gist of the game without having to clock in a ton of time, and I am writing this because I want to basically get to the point of figuring out whether this game is worth it for you the consumer (spending 4 bucks).

And on to the review..

Kill the Plumber is an award-winning 2D platform game where you play the game of Mario, except with a twist.. You are one of the minions whose duty is to take out Mario himself. The man has gone on way too long causing a disturbance in the land where all is edible, so now it is up to you to take out the man who has been giving your people a problem for way too long...

Lets get on to the first part of my review:

Gameplay: The game itself is fun. It used to be free on a website before, and the developers saw the popularity of the game and decided to try and actually make money from it. So what happened? Well, they added more levels apparently and other stuff, but I cannot really tell as I only have played the paid version of this game. And as mentioned before, this game is fun, it is a nice change of pace from other games, and it is a game that you can pick up and put down (well at least I can). The fun is all about trying to finally be the one who gets to be the hunter instead of the hunted.. So I give the game so far 2.0/2.5 for gameplay.

Controls: This is an easy criteria to get a high score for me. And you‚Äôd be suprised at how many developers botch it up while putting games on the PC (I‚Äôm looking at you Resident Evil 6). But as for the controls for the game itself, it is as good as it can get. But that isn‚Äôt too much to be proud of.. 2.0/2.5 for controls.

Bugs/Glitches/Game-breaking stuff: Nothing I‚Äôve noted so far, and checking out the steam forums all seems well there too. This is quite surprising as indie games launch as well as a NASA ship taking off on fire.... 2.0/2.5.

Value: This to me is the most important criteria when it comes to buying a game. For others, this may not matter so much. But, the basic calculation I always do is can I get 1$ per hour out of this game? Personally, I don‚Äôt think I will. It is hard to tell, but I am blowing through the game. Those of you who are really into this genre and want to perfect this game will definitely get full value however... 1.0/2.5 (for balancing purposes).

Overall  7/10.. Not a bad score, and the real question is whether or not the game is worth 4 bucks. Sure, you‚Äôll have a good time, but is it worth it more than that double-cheeseburger from that place down the street... I dono.. Up to you to decide!

Take a look at my first-impressions of the game if you'd like to get a better look:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=invK7fnjFCQ

reviewText:
NOTE: The review was written with a code obtained from the developer.

If Bowser could code, he‚Äôd probably make Kill the Plumber, a puzzle platforming game all about killing a suspiciously familiar looking heroic plumber with equally familiar monster designs thrust under the player‚Äôs command. However, as any Mario player should know, the odds are always stacked against the poor mooks. After all, they don‚Äôt have any power stars or fire flowers to save them from the cruel boot of one Italian superstar. However, they do have one leg over the false hero in Kill the Plumber. Brains.

Yet, despite it's fantastic concept, Kill the Plumber fails to deliver in both presentation and execution.

Read the full review here:
http://techraptor.net/content/kill-the-plumber-review-mario-must-die

reviewText:
Very creative concept! Some mechanics seem a little unpolished, but this gream is REALLY fun.
Kill the Plumber takes a new perspective on platformer games, where the generic hero (Mario) is the villain, and you must control the minions on each level to kill him. It took a lot of thinking for some levels, and a lot of trial and error, but no level I tried was impossible.

As it is now, a 9/10 for concept, 7/10 for art, 7/10 gameplay, and 6/10 polish. It's definitely worth the $4.99

I have a let's play of this game going on, check it out here to see gameplay!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TMzLPIzLWQ4

reviewText: A fun little puzzle game in the guise of being, um, anti-Mario?  Or perhaps, exacting revenge on Mario for all the death he's tolled out over the years?  The levels range from easy to a bit annoying/aggravating, however the difficulty" was a bit scattered throughout for me (instead of a steady escalation).  There were a few levels that involved some pretty darn precise timing that got me stuck for awhile...  I COULD get more than 4 hours out of this...if I practiced to try to "speedrun" each world in the target time shown
date: but a few of the levels are aggravating enough for me that I have no desire to complete ALL the achievements in this one.\n\nOverall though I had a lot of fun as the cut scenes and mechanics used for the various...enemies?...allies?...were cute tributes to the Mario series.  I picked this up in the Indie Gala bundle that's going on now and I'm glad I had.  While I had fun with this title and would recommend it if you like tribute and puzzles games
recommended: I think I would have been more inclined more towards 2 dollars or so (especially as you can apparently play it for free on Newgrounds or whatever).  Like I said
hoursPlayed: I got mine from a bundle so that was worth for me."

reviewText:
Kill the Plumber is a fun Mario Bros. like thing where your goal is swapped around and you must kill Mario, and protect the princess from that stalker plumber.
I finished the flash version of this game (which is shorter) for free on Newgrounds so check it out there if you want to see what it's like.

You need to slowly walk through various levels as boos, goombas, hammer bros and more. You can even throw boomerangs that look like socks!

Throughout the game Mario has various abilities like invincibility and fireballs, and sometimes, you even have a time limit for beating the level.

There are also a bit less than 30 fairly challenging achievements for feeling good about wasting your life killing Mario!

I recommend this game if you want a fairly short, challenging and fun experience.

reviewText:
I remember this as a flash game, it was a game with a nice concept
This is essentially 5 bucks for the same game, with 12 worlds that all have about 9-12 levels
Theres also these 2 extra worlds if you got all the stars or some crap, but they are extremely hard to acheive, and pointless, as they arent that much more difficult, and essentially lock of the game because of certaint things
Pros: Fun game with a great idea and decent graphics
Cons: Bad controls, no way to skip a level if you get stuck on it (Some of the levels are just jerkishly hard)
And the game is rougly 2 hours
It would be more fun to make your own game based off this concept, the only thing i enjoyed about this was how you fought the protagonist as the enemy, but in almost all the levels he was invincable, so you had to kill him, WITHOUT the enemies, completely forgeting what the game set out to do

If you want to make a game similar to this concept, make more content, more enemies (Possibly a workshop feature), make a skip button for any single player experience, and make mulitplayer
